Review Highlight: I moved number today at 15:00 and I‚Ä¶
Review: I moved number today at 15:00 and I still can't use my phone! I used Lebara in Spain and never had problems so I thought to switch up. However I can't even register the number due to several errors and I'm leaving the moment I get PAC. Nothing was simple, several wrong outcomes and I need phone for work. I now need to wait till tomorrow to receive PAC because I was transferred just today. I was also advised to go into store to buy voucher and work my plan through that or register with another email. Ok, fair suggestions but it shouldn't be this complicated, I lost full afternoon and night because your online system, website or app is completely usless and is just flagging error!I also called your customer service first, who advised me to just add money to the account, and they didn't see any problem, took details or rectified the problem. Very poor indeed,  I guess you get what you pay for, lesson learned!

Lebara think I have left them, but that is not at all true. I had been with O2 for many years, indeed I started with Cellnet, the forerunner, back in the 1980‚Äôs and stuck with them until November 2024. I work on the road, frequently in rural areas, and I have always had a back-up phone, as I need to be sure of being able to submit reports, using mobile data, wherever I might be. For many years, I had assumed that O2 had the best coverage for me, and had my back-up phone on BT Mobile (EE Network) for the odd occasions where there was no O2 data coverage. Just over 12 months ago, I moved my back-up phone to Lebara and have been very impressed with the coverage and data speeds. Indeed, I found myself using it more than my main (O2) phone. On the strength of this, I moved my main phone and number to Lebara, on a new contract, and cancelled the old contract, in order to move the back-up number to a cheap sim-only O2 contract. To sum-up, I find Lebara, on the Vodafone network, to be far superior to O2 and EE, at a much cheaper price.

Review Highlight: 5GB if you log in to lebara app
Review: I got an email from lebara saying that 5GB of data will be added to my account if I log in to lebara app. I did log in and couple of days later I got confirmation email saying that extra data has been added to my account. It wasn't. I called customer services and been told that my account will be credited on Friday the 29 of November. It wasn't. I call them again on the 2nd of December and finally got my extra 5GB added, which unfortunately will be valid till 27 of December, not as promised for a full month. I like lebara, I've been with them for a few years  now and convinced my family to switch to lebara as well. Although I will stay with lebara for years to come, so is my family, but this 5GB offer felt short and lebara should think again before sending such an offers that they can't keep.Update:Lebara has contacted me couple of hours after this review and refunded me my monthly plan, which wasn't really necessary or expected, but appreciated. They did apologised for the trouble, I'm just hoping that they will treat my review as a constructive one and fix the issue to avoid future problems with the other customers

Plea to CEO ignored:I write in frustration by the poor service I am receiving from Lebara and a plea to step in. It had already been escalated within Lebara to your senior complaints team. I would have thought that I would have received better care from them, but that has not been the case.  I have been appalled by lack of care and attention that I have been given particularly by Rohan in your senior complaints team. It is now 2 months since I‚Äôve not had proper internet access. I only got any attention when I wrote a poor review on Trustpilot, but now nobody has contacted me. The last intervention from Rohan was 3 weeks ago. He said he would phone me later in the day to check if the latest intervention had been effective (it hadn‚Äôt). That was 3 weeks ago and still no check-up from him. How does someone like Rohan who obviously does not have the capabilities for s service-oriented role, get promoted?I‚Äôve had my SIM replaced twice, I‚Äôve been asked to change some settings twice, yet it takes about a minute for a webpage to load (I attach my latest speed test), and all this time you have the affrontery to keep taking my money each month and I don‚Äôt have an effective service. I wrote poor reviews on Trustpilot and someone called John-Paul Patten, Operations Director, does a copy & paste nonsense: ‚ÄúThanks for taking the time to leave a review. It is very disappointing to hear you feel this way and we would love the chance to put things right. As you left your contact details when leaving the review, a member of my team will reach out to you ASAP.‚Äù, and yet it doesn‚Äôt manifest in real life.I‚Äôm trying to fathom why you have good reviews as it certainly has not been my experience. I‚Äôm a teacher and to be without internet on my phone has been causing many issues for me the past two months. The lack of internal communication between your service agents and your IT is atrocious ‚Äì apparently nobody can call one another! Really? It‚Äôs ridiculous and I‚Äôm paying the price! I‚Äôm fed up speaking to different agents and explaining from the beginning all that has happened. Why is there not one person to seamlessly take me through until a solution has been found? I‚Äôm a teacher and I can‚Äôt receive phone calls from your agents at any time as I have classes of students. I have given specific times I can be available but these are often ignored.  Plus when Lebara text you to say that they are calling, Lebara charge me to reply to you! Why are you charging Lebara customers to reply to you? It‚Äôs been such a mess and such disgraceful behaviour. It‚Äôs now 2 months since I reported this issue - when are you going to find a solution? Plus I feel I deserve compensation for all the hassle I have been put through and at a minimum a refund of what I am paying you each monthI hope that you can give this your urgent attention and keep an eye out whether this has been solved

Review Highlight: Akshay Done a great job quickly and‚Ä¶
Review: I have tried two phones and this network doesn't work, it's absolutely useless at home, I was supposed to be getting a call from customer support last night that didn't happen, I was called through the day yesterday, the operator just started going into auto pilot without asking if it was a good time to talk which it wasn't hence arranging a call later, but the impression I got was they were only interested in me deleting bad reviews.I have only been on Lebara a week and I have already stopped the monthly renewal, I have been unsuccessful swapping data from old phone and my new phone can't update itself because it can't download because the network disappears as soon as I try to do anything.Even voice calls are a struggle, even going outside doesn't help, and I live in a big city so coverage should be good.Bring back 3g, it was much more reliable, 4g and 5g is useless.

Because I fell asleep in the afternoon, the computer automatically switched to the mobile data traffic. As a result, the data traffic exceeded the limit. When I woke up, I felt like the sky had fallen. I was very worried that the excess data traffic would be deducted a sky-high fee. For this reason, I contacted Lebara's customer service. The customer service patiently answered my confusion and warmly comforted me.

Review Highlight: Selvaraj was quick with a clear with response
Review: I've been with this network for two months or so, really affordable, almost no connectivity problems. They offer a better deal than my previous supplier were offering.My big issue is I hate the age verification thing. You have to use text verification, your camera(!) for face scanning and then restart to access any filtered websites. It's really unpleasant to have to allow a third party company access to your camera, and the safe search only seems to be suspended for one browsing session meaning you have to keep doing it, restarting your phone and half the time it still doesn't lift the website blocker. It's definitely making me reconsider staying with the network after my cut-price period ends.

Review Highlight: Lebara is the best mobile service!
Review: A shame I had to even give 1 star! Moved nearly 2 weeks ago from o2 (which worked amazingly well, but I felt like a change due to price rises) so chose the 'too good to be true' Lebara deal.  What a mistake!  I haven't had internet connection at all not even for a minute in those 2 weeks.  TWICE sent messages, as instructed, to receive settings to connect internet, NOTHING ARRIVED! Rang twice to be told they had to open a complaint case.  Had enough, so requested PAC no to return to o2.  Someone then called and had the nerve to ask why I was leaving Lebara.  Words fail me.  Only the bad reviews about Lebara on trustpilot are the true reviews.  I believe all others are fakes.  STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY.  From 29/11/24 I'm back with o2 and have full connection and brilliant service.

Review Highlight: Arnold helped me to cancel an order‚Ä¶
Review: I was with Lebara for about a year after my former provider stopped doing mobile. Everything went smoothly with Lebara and it was very cheap too. But when I went to Germany for a week I found that its EU roaming offer was bad, and communication with Lebara was defective. I only had reception through hotel wifi. The Lebara chat told me to Google Vodafone Germany, German Telekomm etc. I decided that I was simply unable to phone without paying more and it was unclear how to pay more. What's App didn't work either. Two friends were annoyed when it took me 3 hours to receive messages on a change of plans. I texted Lebara from the hotel again and found my contract was recent so I would have to pay extra for Wifi. Lebara gave me a link but it didn't work. Terrible service and above all communication. I wouldn't mind paying extra but how was I to do that? I was silly to believe the Lebara slogan "Roam like at home".

Review Highlight: The fast response and the agent was‚Ä¶
Review: After a headache trying to set up mobile broadband with Vodafone, Lebara offered a smooth, flexible and competitively-priced alternative. I have signed up for the rolling unlimited data plan to be used in a Huawei hotspot dongle, and have been extremely satisfied by the service. The data speeds have also been more than sufficient for home usage (they use Vodafone's network which is strong in my area), though it's worth noting that the speed seems to be capped at around 190 Mbps (not sure if this is on Lebara or Vodafone's end) - this is not a problem for me however. I have been positively surprised in the past two months, and can only hope it stays this way!

Review Highlight: I was absolutely delighted to get help‚Ä¶

Not for the first time Lebara have cancelled the SIM on both our phones saying the contract has expired.  On Thursday the day they took the money, they messaged to say the plan had been renewed. Today we both had messages to say he plan had expired. I checked with the bank; they took payment yesterday, as usual on the agreed date. Tried to speak to them .....nearly an hour later I gave up and emailed. So. Until they sort it, we have no phones. Do they care,let's see.Update. Spoke to Lebara Sunday morning, and was told all Lebara customers received this email. He was pretty coy about any other details. So, if they knew, why didn't they email everyone and tell them. Anyway, All's well that ends well.Update (2) Ah, the elusive John Paul. He carries a heavy burden being the person who is always going to call back, to resolve any problem, and in my experience never does. I could be wrong, let's see.

Review Highlight: Good experience and totally solved my‚Ä¶
Review: Dishonoured. For example when I attempted to contact customer service I was introduced to a message informing me on this companies "Exceptional service". 1st issue Is and many of us are aware that customer service numbers sometimes intentionally have very annoying wait music and repetitive messages to get you off the phone which isn't acceptable, treat your customers with more respect especially as they're calling up about a problem, it's so disrespectful and everyone knows, the public aren't stupid. 2nd this is the only customer service number where the wait time has gone up in my experience as it tells you every ten seconds how long you have left with ridiculous music in-between if that wasn't enough. The person I spoke with asked if he could get someone to call me back right after I had waited and literally endured that discomfort to hopefully then get my problem seen too, and I'm met with that. Now my request was so simple there are countless apps which Claim to resolve the issue I had but it just wasn't working in my case. Then when I deny that request due to the very simple task he then goes on a ln unnecessary data gathering quest even though said person had all the information they needed. He also just cut the phone off without saying goodbye, maybe it was an inconvenient time for me to call, maybe his shift was over I don't know but it remains to be seen whether my issue will be resolved. If it is I may amend this but exceptional customer service I think not. Would you call this an exceptional experience?. The deals are good hence the 3 stars but you got 2 knocked off for the reasons above. Hate dishonesty or tactics which are intentionally made to make the consumers life even more difficult which is a disgrace if you think about it especially when you're calling up about an issue in the first place more than likely. Not cool so yeah iron out these creases and maybe you'll be close to the exceptional service you claim. This is my honest experience, I am optimistic things will improve ü§û

Review Highlight: Anum was very helpful explaining how to‚Ä¶
Review: Recently, I encountered an issue when purchasing a ¬£1.25 50GB phone card package. Initially, I mistakenly thought the payment would be deducted from my top-up balance, so I added ¬£5 to my account. However, the payment failed, and I realized that the package cost must be paid via a bank card. This left me unsure of how to resolve the issue.I then contacted customer service, and Aditya's assistance was exceptional. He patiently verified the package details on my number and explained how to reactivate the previous plan through the account dashboard. When I learned that my top-up balance couldn‚Äôt be used directly for the package payment, he proactively offered to process a refund for the ¬£5 top-up. The entire process was clear and efficient, greatly alleviating my concerns.The experience highlighted the professionalism and efficiency of the customer support team. If I need assistance in the future, I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to them again.

Review Highlight: I locked my SIM card this morning
Review: I switched to Lebara from ID Mobile in the hopes that I would get better coverage via Vodafone in my area. Admittedly the coverage was slightly better - when my phone worked‚Ä¶I wanted to keep my old number so had it ported in. There was zero warning about any issues I may face with this, yet I couldn‚Äôt use my phone for 24 hours and then when it did finally work, I couldn‚Äôt receive any texts or calls unless it was someone else on the Lebara network (I only know this as my mum also switched, with issues herself‚Ä¶). I also can‚Äôt properly use my iCloud which has lost info on certain apps such as Notes, because my phone number is no longer associated with my phone.Over the course of a week, I spoke to probably 5 or so different online agents who all got me to change different settings, one even sent me a replacement sim (which stopped my mobile data working for a while, again with no warning this could happen), got me to try the sim in different phone handsets, and I had formal complaints logged to the technical team on my behalf with assurance it would be fixed in 24-48 hours. Shock - nothing was fixed.This is still ongoing over a week later, people can‚Äôt get hold of me (especially worrying in the event of an emergency) and I‚Äôve been waiting for a phone call for a hospital consult appointment which I can‚Äôt receive so no idea if I‚Äôll miss my chance at getting an appointment any time soon.When I told them I was going to leave, Lebara tried to get me to wait another 24-48 hours to get their technical team to fix it (even though they hadn‚Äôt fixed it this whole time) even though I told them it‚Äôs still not working a week later so I‚Äôve now decided to switch back to ID mobile as I never had this issue.My mum and her husband both joined Lebara who switched from a different network than me and we live in different areas - they both had similar issues but worse as they had even less functions for a few days.We found forums of so many other people having similar issues. How can it be acceptable for this to happen in 2024? We rely on our phones for so many basic things these days. What would have happened if I was out somewhere on my own and relying on Google maps to get me home, but I couldn‚Äôt use it because my data stopped working with no warning? Or someone was extremely ill or hurt and needed to call me for help? I needed to do basic things like renew my car insurance which I couldn‚Äôt pay for myself because I couldn‚Äôt even receive the text to approve the bank payment. I‚Äôm lucky enough that my husband was able to use his bank card for me instead, but not everyone would have that option.Really really poor service and for this to have happened multiple times then Lebara should at a minimum give very clear warnings of these possible consequences of switching to them so that people can make the choice of possibly not being able to use their phone for days/weeks.
I have been asked to repeat the process for verification many times. Not happy

Based on my experience with Lebara, I would strongly advise all future customers to read this review before signing up to Lebara. After signing up to Lebara on the 4/11/24 and requested a port date of 8/11/24, the Sim arrived and was registered and activated as instructed, we then received a second sim the next day, at which point we contacted Lebara and was told to keep using the first sim. Unfortunately the first sim stopped working the next day and again we contacted Lebara and was told that we are using the correct sim and they would investigate, after contacting Lebara the following day, I was told that we should use the second sim we received and not the first, this initially did not resolve the issue and after another call to Lebara we were told to wait 24 hours whilst they investigated, by now the port date of the 8/11/24 had past and I was left without a working Lebara sim. We finally had a partially working sim after 5 days, we could receive calls and send and receive SMS on the Lebara sim, but was not able to make calls from it. Daily calls with Lebara took place to ask for an update and for the problem to be escalated as I am a carer for my bed ridden elderly mother and disabled sister and it is vital doctors and carers can reach me. After 11 days of chasing Lebara I received an email advising the port had completed, but on checking it had not, if anything it had gotten worse!  To cut a long story short, it has now been 12 days and we still do not have a fully working Lebara sim, unable to make outbound calls, the port to my old vodafone number has not happened and on top of which my old Vodafone number seems to have been disconnected.I have spoken to Lebara everyday, and everyday they advise they have and will re-escalate to their technical team and we have to wait another 24 hours, and to date it has still not been rectified.I will be raising a formal complaint with Lebara as well as Ofcom, I would strongly advise against signing up with Lebara!

I had previously been happy with Lebara but their Refer & Earn scheme seems to be a scam, as they are simply not paying out for a successful referral. I have spoken to customer service people via chat several times, and every time they have tried to tell me that they need a bit more time to check the referral. Earlier this week the person I chatted with raised a complaint on my behalf about this and promised a reply within a couple of days, which also hasn't happened. It's now been four months since the referral and it is still pending. I can only come to the conclusion that there is no actual intention to ever pay out for successful referrals and just leave them pending in the hope customers will forget about them.EDIT: After writing this review, I was contacted by Lebara and they have now paid out for the referral as well as increased the amount to compensate for the trouble. I was then asked to edit my review. Happy that this has now been resolved, but it is quite amazing that these are the lengths you have to go to. If anyone else has the same problem, I would recommend writing also writing a review on here.

Review Highlight: Raunak was great and very helpful
Review: I bought a Lebara Sim and package, persuaded by the good rating. What a mistake.1. I bought the ¬£10 package with unlimited UK calls and 100 minutes of international. But when I called, I got a message, "your balance is zero, buy a top up". Like an idiot I did but got the same message. So I paid ¬£20, for a ¬£10 that doesn't work.2. I called the helpline, they could not hear me. Four times I called or they called back, every single time, within one minute, they said they could not hear me as the line was breaking up. So, bad lines.3. They managed to tell me that the international calls are only to some countries and do not include Sri Lanka, which I needed. That was not mentioned on the pack I bought in the shop. "It's on the website" they replied, as if that made it all ok. I checked the website, only 51 countries are included out of nearly 200. So 75% of countries are NOT included. Deceptive?4. UK calls do not include calls to companies or premium numbers. Only regular numbers. Again not mentioned on the package.On the website the message "no strings attached" is repeated everywhere. But there are strings attached - plenty of them!So - I cannot call companies; I cannot call to the country I need to call; and whenever I do call the line degrades within a minute so they can't hear me.I paid ¬£20 for a ¬£10 packages that does not so what it says it will.Update - it was nice to see a concerned reply from Lebara. However, after sending the requested mail, I have still not heard from them!

Review: I've been with Lebara for a month. Very good prices and no problems making or receiving calls but my only problem is that I've never been able to get the voicemail working. All I get when I call 121 is a recorded message which says "We are working on it and your voicemail will be activated in the next hours". Sadly, it never does get activated. They've sent me a new sim card and I've tried that but still have the same problem.It's so frustrating!
Its a great review experience and good help me put for a plan...

Attracted by the price and free roaming, I changed to Lebara from EE and it was 2+ weeks of frustration to get the number ported, to be able to make/receive calls, get online, it was just a disaster. After 2 weeks I could still not send a text to any android phone. Every time customer support was contacted, I was told a ticket would be raised and the issue resolved in 24-48 hours. This never happened. Nobody who answered the phone was able to help me directly. I am at a loss as to how this company is so highly rated, maybe I was just unlucky. After 3 weeks I ordered a SIM from Sky and ALL services including number port, calls, texts, iMessage, facetime, etc were running with no issues inside 36 hours. I certainly cannot recommend Lebara based on my experience.

Review Highlight: Nitin was very helpful and professional
Review: ‚ÄúI want to express my appreciation for Akshay. He provided outstanding service, demonstrating great knowledge and responsiveness throughout my inquiry. His assistance made the process smooth and enjoyable. Thank you, Akshay, for your excellent support!‚Äù

I had been using my first phone with a Lebara card for 18 months without problems until last week when I found I had burned through my monthly 5GB allowance in a fortnight. I am not a heavy user and was perplexed at having apparently used so much.I rang CS and got friendly and helpful service from Imran Khairdi who restored my service without charge by giving me a new month's data plan starting from the day I was cut off, i.e. the previous fortnight's use was, effectively, not charged for.I was nervous about contacting Lebara, thinking they would basically say 'tough' but not a bit of it. I will never know what used up my month's data so fast - and they couldn't tell me, either - but I am relieved to be back online so quickly and at cost only to Lebara, not myself.Thank you, Imran and Lebara, it's a joy to find such helpful and pleasant people on the end of the CS phone, it's often not the case with other companies. Didn't have to wait long for my call to be answered, either.One satisfied customer. :)EDIT: It turned out to be my new TV, which I hadn't connected to my WiFi and which was draining my data. Sorted it out with my broadband service provider but am disappointed that no-one at Lebara - and I phoned a second time - thought to ask me if I had a new device that might be causing the problem. Second person I spoke to suggested I pay for more data! So one star deducted for this but am still happy with the generous way in which Imran helped me out.

I called and was connected to Glory who patiently listened to my explanation on how I got the line and how I ve been using it since entering the UK in December 2022,and how I am unable to use it because it wasn't registered in my name. She (Glory) asked me to mention 4 last digits of numbers I called and after giving the numbers,she explained that the problem is that the line is still registered in d last user's email address and she proceeded to activate the process of getting the line registered in my details, which I will do on Monday, 4th November, 2024.I am very impressed with the professional way Glory handled the issue I raised with her and how she brought a mosr satisfactory closure to it. I recommend her for a Customer Service Award of Excellence, if the Lebara Network offers such. Thank you.Victor Chinedum Ezebuiro235 Oxhill RoadHandsworth, B21 8HABirmingham

2nd poor review in an attempt to get our problem solved!Another week, another disappointing experience - this time with my son's phone. He has been unable to make or recieve phone calls for 2 weeks (possibly longer as it may have taken a while to realise there was a problem).Multiple phone calls, chats and excuses. Everything from call divert had been activated (not by us), problems with the network in my area, blaming my the handset (have tried in a different handset), sending a replacement SIM, waiting 48 hours each time I was given a reason...they even tried calling the phone that isn't working instead of myself despite promises that my number had been noted.So much time spent trying to sort this out.So we have had enough! We shall be leaving Lebara when this month's contract is up, unless the problem is fixed.I think it only fair to point out that friends who use them have had no issues. Perhaps we are just unlucky.

Have been with Lebara mobile for a couple of weeks, the Network is good, signed 3 more Family members to the present USwitch Lebara deals, 3 months @ half price. My Sister signed up for the 50GB for ¬£9.95 per month but the first 3 months @ ¬£4.98, trouble was they actually charged her ¬£10.00? My Sister rang there Customer Service department (5588) and answered the required security questions, she requested for me to speak to the CS agent on her behalf. I explained the overpayment situation and that the 50% reduction was in fact not applied on the SIM only deal, the CS agents name was Allen, he checked my Sisters account and stated that there was "No 50% off deals on the USwitch site" I had checked on the day of signing my Sister up and got this deal? I checked while I was talking to Allen and sure enough the deal was still on the UK USwitch site. Half an hour later Allen was still insisting that there was no such deal on USwitch, at this point I insisted that I needed to speak to a supervisor, eventually a supervisor did come on the line and agreed with me that "Yes there is a deal on USwitch for 50% off all SIM only deals" at long last someone who seems to know what they are talking about, the supervisors name was Amar. I have never felt so insulted to be told by a so called Customer Service agent that I was in effect telling lies, myself and my Wife + Brother-in-Law had received the 50% discount on our first monthly payment, it was humiliating to be virtually called a Liar, the deal was there, found by Amar in a couple of minutes yet Allen could not come across it after 30 minutes! Serious retraining is needed with this particular member of staff, we are all shocked at the poor way our account enquiry was handled and any further treatment like this, myself and 3 members of Family will be leaving this Network with very poor Customer Service we received today, Allen was probably an Asian gentleman who spoke to me in broken English which made the situation more difficult to get rectified, would be a perfect Network if staff in there Customer Service Department  knew what the hell they were talking about!!!

Review Highlight: Aadesh from Lebara was so helpful
Review: Lebara and Three have caused me to lose my long-held phone number - mobile customers in the UK should think twice before switching network providers.In August, I was recommended the Lebara Plan, which offered a discounted monthly fee and no annual contract. Consequently, I stopped my monthly plan with Three, which I had been using for over ten years, and switched to Lebara's supposedly contract-free plan. However, after a few weeks, I noticed that some YouTube features had inexplicably disappeared, and network reception was poor. So, I decided to switch back to Three at the Queensway/Bayswater store on October 6th. Unfortunately, this marked the beginning of a nightmare: I lost my UK phone number, which I had used for over ten years.Besides causing me significant distress, what frustrated me the most was the continuous passing of responsibility between the customer service teams of the two companies, leaving me to bear the consequences alone.When UK customers wish to switch mobile network providers while retaining their old phone number, they must notify their existing provider to obtain a PAC code. However, the staff at the Three Queensway/Bayswater store failed to remind me of this crucial step.Moreover, it also seems that the staff member may have informed Lebara of my departure, which led to Lebara erroneously issuing a STAC code. On October 6, 2024, I received a text message from Lebara containing a STAC code, which I later found out indicated Three had notified Lebara of my intention to leave. As a result, Lebara used this STAC code as a reason to completely remove my original number from their system.Lebara then claimed there was no record of my original number and thus could not provide me with a PAC code.In reality, they are making excuses to evade responsibility. Besides sending me a text on October 6, 2024, attempting to convince me to stay with Lebara, I called their customer service multiple times hoping to retrieve my PAC code, but they ignored my requests and provided no assistance for over a week since 15 October, 2024.Similarly, Three's customer service was unhelpful, telling me I had to find a way to ask Lebara for the PAC code myself; otherwise, Three could not help me recover my old phone number from Lebara.Mobile customers risk becoming victims of the fierce competition among telecom companies - please beware, because if your number is lost, no accountability will be taken.

I did not have to go through the whole process again. Also, the issue was sorted out quickly and efficiently. Thank you Prathamesh and Lebara.

Switched to Lebara a while back - super cheap and good service. Had an issue recently with my SIM card, but spoke with Mukesh on Customer Service and he resolved the problem quickly.

Edit: Lebara got in touch to rectify the issue on 3rd November to revert my plan back - have updated my 1 star review accordinglyI found the value of these sim-only plans very reasonable, especially with the uswitch offers available, and I have found the phone reception to be fine over the last 2 years that I have used this service.However, I am disappointed with my recent experience when I ran out of monthly data for the first time. I followed the steps for what I believed to be topping up my allowance as a one-off (which was an incredibly convoluted and confusing process). And in the months since I have been charged a higher amount for a lower amount of data. On calling customer service today, I was advised that I had been signed up to a new monthly plan, not a one-off top up, and that there was absolutely nothing they could do to reverse this action - despite me pointing out that Lebara did not make this clear at the time. They said I could sign up for an alternative Lebara plan for the same, new/higher price which would give me extra data, which I do not need or want. Unsatisfactory customer service, unfortunately!

Review Highlight: Lebara and Three have caused me to lose‚Ä¶
Review: Sagar was excellent and remedied my problem quickly

Terrible customer service and now I've had no response twice and the problem hasn't been resolved or answered.I have switched from Vodafone to Lebara (yes I know V own L) my number was forwarded seamlessly and the price amazing as I'm paying way less for more data. The first month was no problem, after one month my phone stopped working, showing no signal at all. I tried another sim card and that worked, I contacted Lebara and they reset the system and I was told it would work in a few hours, it did not. I recontacted the help team and they suggested a new sim card despite the fact my sim worked in another phone. New sim card arrived and it did not work in my phone, it took a while to work in another phone, I then retried it in my phone and no joy. I contacted Lebara, they suggested yet another sim card, I stated I had a new one, it works in one phone not mine, the other sim card works in my phone so it isn't my phone, I asked does Lebara no longer support the Samsung S24 Ultra? I had no reply. A week later I sent another message asking why I had no response and how we could fix the issue as I'm paying for a contract that I cannot use. I had no reply. I have bought myself another phone and so far it is working... hopefully it continues to work longer than 1 month. I find it very rude that no effort was made to fix my problem and I have had to buy myself another phone, when my phone does work on 2 other networks and it is unlocked.

Useful app. Good offers now and again; e.g. more free data which I don't need! I'm about to move my sole trader SIM to them because 1pMobile has put their prices up by 50% so Lebara is now cheaper than 1pMobile. Good! I Love Lebara.

I switched to Lebara from another network and I kept my previous number. Now the line doesn't make or receive calls, but the SIM is working as I receive SMSs. I contacted Lebara customer support 3 times and each time they say: "a ticket will be raised and the technical team will resolve this issue", but NOTHING happens. I've been without a working line for over 1 week now. While the customer support is great and (my reason for the 1 star), yet the actual experience has been very disappointing. I now regret switching to Lebara.I reached out again to Lebara Customer Support today and their feedback was: "We received the update today so from today another 24-48 hours you have to wait. Reason being when somebody is calling you it is not getting connected to Lebara network and they need to fix that." I have been complaining for a week now, and only now they "discover" what the problem is and again I have to wait? This is never ending... and I'm not even sure that after "24-48 hours" the line will work!Fastforward 1 week or more later, and I'm still WITHOUT a working line, Lebara claims the technical team are trying to resolve. They must be really making a "tremendous"!! effort since nothing is happening. In the meantime, I complain to customer support every day, hoping that my message goes through at a certain point.I contacted customer service again today, who were finally able to pinpoint the problem and now my line is actually working. At least I'm happy about that.

Review Highlight: Best customer service.Today I had an enquiry regarding my‚Ä¶

Review Highlight: Support user Nagmukesh was very helpful
Review: I moved to Lebara from 1P mobile after seeing what seemed like a great deal on Money Saving Expert. I moved to Lebara on 8th October, the porting date was 10th October. According to Lebara the porting was completed on this date, but no not completely. While I could call and text out I could not receive calls or text on the porting date.It was not until the afternoon of 15th October that I could receive calls and texts. Now (21st October) I can not receive text meaning I could not login to my online bank. I called tech support and she sent me a text. She asked did you receive the text, I said yes, she said give the bank your number then she cut the call. My bank already have my phone number. It seems that I can only receive text from the Lebara network.Lebara chat is a waste of time and calling support is not much better. One person at support said ‚ÄúIt takes longer to port incoming calls and text‚Äù, another at support said ‚Äúthe Vodafon network had an outage for three days‚Äù, oh yes I have my doubts.It reads on the Lebara contract summary, moving your number to Lebara is easy, I don't think so, not in my case.Update, things sorted on 22nd October. A disappointing start with porting my old number, however all is well now. Everything is working as it should.

UPDATE: I emailed John-Paul after his response and someone from the call centre called me to resolve the issue. While mid-sentence to them I lost signal and the call dropped and I‚Äôve heard nothing since. Looking at the reviews, most praise customer service rather than the signal - a perk if you‚Äôre feeling lonely and need to talk to a friendly voice but judging by the number of people who‚Äôve called them with issues - not great if you‚Äôre time poor and just want a sim that works.I‚Äôve had the Lebara SIM for a year having moved from EE to cut the monthly cost, which was the draw as I was paying ¬£0.99 a month but the price has just increased to ¬£7.90. This would be ok except that I have found the signal reflects the price (the ¬£0.99 price. I doubt it will be any different now I‚Äôm paying 600% more). I thought that because Lebara used the Vodafone network it would be fine, but it hadn‚Äôt. I rarely have good signal, WhatsApp calls frequently drop or don‚Äôt connect, apps regularly don‚Äôt load and the worst issue has been trying to use google maps in London without success and nearly missing appointments. I‚Äôve got used to it because for ¬£0.99 the signal reflected the service but now it‚Äôs more expensive the compromise isn‚Äôt worth it. Vodafone may be a reliable provider to its own customers but I‚Äôm not sure it gives the same access to other providers. The Lebara service team have tried to help a number of times without success. Sorry Lebara, I like your low prices but I can‚Äôt live with the poor mobile signal.

So disappointed because i came here first over a month ago to see their reviews before joining up with them. Nobody who hasn't given out their new mobile number should be receiving or being harassed by spam calls on a daily basis unless that mobile network they have recently joined has given them an old customers or an old used phone number.The service or should i say lack of services from both Lebara agents was appalling today and i certainly wouldn't and won't be recommending them to anyone after only being with them a month.

Review Highlight: Issue with multiple data add on fee
Review: My call was attended to swiftly by Juveriya, my problem was resolved promptly.

Lebara run a 'Refer and Earn' promotion whereby existing users refer a friend via a link and they earn while new users get 3 months of 50% off... A friend referred me as I needed two new sims and I signed up using the referral link. All was okay until upon completing the order I was billed the full amount.My friend received confirmation that the refer and earn was successful.  When logging into my lebara account, my package summary shows me on the 50% off promotion yet Lebara continue to bill me the full amount.When I try Lebara support they say my account was taken out at the full cost. They cannot understand that there may be an issue and only suggest I take out a new account on a new link despite already paying. The package was advertised falsely, Lebara are charging more that agreed and refuse to acknowledge there may be a problem with their account.

One star for refunding my latest monthly subscription today.Wow such glowing reviews about Lebara and all in the last few hours. Wow ! Such a great service to have so many glowing 5 star reviews on trust pilot and all very recent( like the last few hours or day or so). Lebara are very lucky to have such genuinely satisfied customers it warms the heart to see so many genuine people sending in yhes v5star ratingsHere is my experience with Lebara over the last 41 hours. No connection since yesterday morning. I was informed the network connection would be rsetored by 7pm (08/10).As of now it appears that (I Have been advised by Lebara customer services) reconnection will take up to 48 to 72 hours. It is a Vodafone network issue.Basically without phone connectin to calls and data for days to come ! I had to discover this by my own enquiries as no messages were sent by Lebara to advise me. Not exactly a 5 star service you might say think or conclude.I am so pleased mind you that so many loyal customers have very recently written 5 star reviews in the past hours and day. Alas it is unlikely that I will remain a loyal customer beyond my contract expiry date next month despite their abundant 5 star service ( look at their tremendous reviews ?).I look forward to being able to use my phone to make calls and access data at some point in the next 72 hours when I can enjoy their 5 star service once again like all those appreciative review customers. I wonder am I Suffering from F.O.M.O.Well done Lebara (and Vodafone) and great work in keeping me and your other customers informed.

I used to be with Vodafone and really really regret changing. Really often when someone tries to call me it says my phone is switched off. I've taken to calling my phone from a work phone to see if its able to receive calls.When I make a call it sounds fine to me, but the person at the other end always has trouble hearing me. When I called Lebara to log the fault the "help desk" hung up twice as they couldn't hear me.It's not like I'm in the middle of nowhere, in one of the places there's a Vodafone mast on top of the building. Everyone else's phones work ok. I've started to use my work phone for personal calls as it's impossible to make a call on this network.I've had nothing but trouble from Lebara, AVOID AVOID AVOID!

Absolutely Terrible Experience - Avoid at All Costs!I‚Äôm beyond frustrated and disappointed with the service I received. Recently, I requested a simple usage report for my iPhone repair claim through my insurance. Instead of providing the report, they BLACKLISTED my phone without my consent or any warning! Because of this absurd mistake, I missed all my work calls, family calls, and had no network access for FOUR DAYS. I had to go out and buy another phone just to report this to Lebara!When I finally reached out to their support, they casually mentioned that requesting a usage report automatically blacklists the phone. Are you kidding me?! I specifically told them that my phone wasn‚Äôt lost‚ÄîI just needed a report for insurance purposes! No one informed me about this ‚Äúbarring‚Äù nonsense when I called initially. Then, as if things weren‚Äôt bad enough, they demanded a letter from my insurance company to confirm that I didn‚Äôt claim a lost device.After running around to get this letter, I‚Äôve now spoken to FIVE or SIX different agents, and my phone is still not fixed. SIX DAYS of utter chaos, stress, and inconvenience‚Äîall because they can‚Äôt get their act together. I deeply regret using their service, and I would never recommend it to anyone. If you value your time, money, and sanity, stay far away. They have absolutely no regard for making a customer‚Äôs life easier.

Review Highlight: Cancelled my plan with no warning

Great service

I have had lots of problems with portin of my Vodafone number into lebara where it finally worked for 3 hours and then the service stopped completely, although my ported in number was still attached to the lebara account.  The support from the chat wasn‚Äôt great. Although agents were always available they didn‚Äôt seem to know how to fix it - I was just being told to do various resets and the wait and it would resolve - first 30 mins, then 2 hours, then 24 hours. This was going on and on, and each time the problem wasn‚Äôt resolved and I was without service. I spent hours on the chat over several days during which I didn‚Äôt have service from lebara and not from Vodafone either as as far as they were concerned the portin had happened.So today finally I used a different phone (mine not working of course!) and called the support line instead and spoke with Aadesh who has been absolutely brilliant and has resolved the problem. (Permanently I hope). He explained that the portin process involves a complex transfer of files and sometimes a bug can be transferred which means things stop working. Luckily I had  bought a new lebara sim for ¬£1 at a corner shop (otherwise they would have sent me another but that would have been further time without service) and he talked me through how to register this to work with the number I had ported in. He made various adjustments to things at the lebara end, and then hooray it is working! He took lots of time and didn‚Äôt hurry me off the line, and he checked that texts, calls and internet were all working. So effectively he fixed it while I was on the line to him rather than asking me to wait for 24 hours for precisely nothing to happen as I‚Äôd been asked by some of the chat agents.  He has promised me that the service won‚Äôt all stop after 3 hours like it did before and I‚Äôm really hoping that‚Äôs right. He also called me back straight away when I explained that I would incur high charges on the landline phone I‚Äôd had to use to call. So really top marks for Aadesh for providing excellent customer service, and thank you for listening properly and taking the time to resolve this. Not sure yet what I think of lebara as a whole, as it hasn‚Äôt been a great start, but hopefully all will go smoothly from now on.
EXPERTISE - COMPETENCE AND PRECISION

Review Highlight: Raunak was quick in his response and‚Ä¶
Review: I moved to Lebara just over a week ago, having been with my previous provider for many years. Since moving to my current property over 4 years ago, I'd had problems with phone signal and no mobile data (when WIFI not available). I noticed a difference immediately with Lebara. I can make calls from anywhere in my home - no more having to go outside to improve signal. If I turn my WIFI off I have perfect 4G coverage. I've received an introductory 6 month discount too. No problems at all with installing new sim, and swapping across original number. To summarise, I'm delighted with the service provided by Lebara, and highly recommend.

When I had a problem with a roaming add on, I phoned the Lebara helpline and Prakriti was really helpful and solved my problem for me. I'm grateful for her help. I appreciated having a phone number to phone and not only an online 'Chat' option.

Review Highlight: Aadesh really helped me with my data he‚Ä¶

Edited review 08/10/2024:I did tackle this problem from another angle the morning after my initial review and in the end got a better quality telephone line and a Lebara Rep of the old school- Mr. Puneet Desai who was wonderful! Not only did he help me with my account specs, he was able taking the time to explain the need for Top-Ups etc. Sending me vital links for each step i needed to take. (These steps bc of my disabilities did take me until the morning of 08/10/24 to master). But i mastered them with Lebara's/ Mr Desai's help. I was also impressed that Mr Puneet Desai followed up and called me 72hrs later to check that everything was working fine? It was. I am happy. My phone does what it should.I changed the stars from two to four because of the above. I am very grateful for Mr Desai's help. So thank you very much Puneet! However Lebara does need to be proactive and prepare for an aging consumer base with an accessible outreach for all disabled customers in the next few years. You have had the edge, you just need to sharpen it and improve on what the competition already lacks.Lebara isn't doing so well these days. Ever since the Microsoft global glitch earlier this year that seriously affectedLebara's coverage and performance the system has been unreliable. Today i need the help of their Customer Service. Can i get through? Only to the automated answering Service which does not register the "0" tapped in on the keypad per instructions four times. Then aborts the call telling me to contact Lebara via "Chat" which begs the question how does a blind individual type in a chat window to a computerised script that does not understand disabilities and the inherent limitations disabled people cope with?

Review Highlight: amazing service never got like this‚Ä¶
Review: I contacted the company due to a query on my account using their online chat (which took 30mins!) and was told I would be contacted in the next 3 days by email. I consequently missed an unexpected phone call later that day as was in the bathroom (I was only given 5 min text warning of the call!) and there was a message they would call the next day. I waited for 2 days but no call.  During the online chat I was asked to send a picture of my account which I did and had an email response asking me to reply. I did reply to that email and have had no response from Lebara to that contact either.While I have been happy with the phone service since being with Lebara I am not satisfied with the customer service and have wasted far too much time waiting for responses that have not appeared.How can you treat people this way? What should have been a quick resolution has taken far too much of my precious time and is still ongoing.UpdateSince writing this I did get a call from Lebara! The situation has been sorted and for my inconvenience I got a 1 month refund (less than ¬£5) - so not the most generous of companies but at least it is sorted for me this time.

Review Highlight: I called to lebara customer service and‚Ä¶
Review: I must say Lebara are good at customer service, 5 out of 5 but the problem I'm having, is I've tried three Sims from three, Lebara and 02, the two that were the worst for signal was Lebara and three network, even though I asked what was wrong with the signal, as it's been over two years since the problem happened with three network, I changed networks due to that problem, change over to 02 same problem, Lebara same problem, so obviously in a busy city where I live, it isn't necessary to help potential customers use a service they pay for? When in reality I'm not paying for something that doesn't work, it's such a pity this problem hasn't been resolved, and this is a university, college area and cathedral church that is world wide known in the UK, can't get a good signal at all. I thought Lebara was going to be good when I first enquired about getting a SIM over two weeks ago. Get the SIM and I'm having issues already, I've used the SIM in two phones and they're the exact same. Videos load up but don't run smoothly to watch, very frustrating and kind of upset that three companies can't sort a mast out, 2 years later, kind of disgraceful in this day and age. Not sure why people want 5g when 4g is just perfect, 5 g just made things worse with the masts being affected. Loss of customers, kind of showing with the big three Vodafone 02 and three, they're basically have the exact same bandwidth and signal dBm. Exact same ... No real difference there, be wise in what offers you good signal and what companies want from you, they just want your money, they don't care about the infrastructure and if they do it's not for your behalf as all. They'll bend over backwards for their governing bodies and corporations. Not us the people, the paying, people. Sorry but you've lost another customer, could have been good.
Transfer from another network was easy and I now have same data,more calls and text than before for third of price. Simple to use app lets me see my usage. Always notified when money will be taken.

This is the worst mobile phone company in the UK. I have been fighting with them for over a year and even after two upheld Communications Ombudsman complaints and over 200 emails they have still not resolved the problems. Their customer service is non-existent. Every time you contact them you will be told everything will be resolved in 24 hours or you will be contacted in 24 hours. 24 hours latter nothing has changed and you have not been contacted. I am now having to take this company to the small claims court to receive proper compensation for a lost mobile number, disconnected service and over charging. Do not believe the Operations Director email address that they will give you when you post a bad review on Trustpilot. This address has be copied into every email I have sent with a read request option. This man either works every hour of the day or it is simply redirected to the care team. I have had receipts from his email address between 8 in the morning until 8:30 at night, but have never had a reply from the man himself.The reply has the email address I was speaking about. As 2 emails where sent to the address yesterday and read at 19:40 and 20:51 from the read receipts I received.

Review Highlight: Ashish was very helpful and dealt with‚Ä¶
Review: I have been with Lebara since early 2024 after a sim hacking courtesy of A$da M¬©bile. I do not have this Lebara number listed or saved anywhere, it's not used on any web sites or shopping sites, yet I CONSTANTLY receive spam calls - 16 while on holiday here in the UK last week alone! They all show up as a mobile number, but all the numbers I need to know are on my contacts list and show who they are. I let these unknown spam mobile numbers ring out, then block, and report to 7726. However, I live alone, and having previously been the victim of a SIM swap hack, it scares me. Do Lebara sell customers number? As far as I know, my details have not been used in any data breaches elsewhere, so why is this happening? I have received 2 more today, and I'm sick of it. I will be going with Glff G#ff - my partner has been with them for years, and not had a single spam call or security breach. Apart from the spam calls, Lebara's 'customer service' is less than useless - based in India, they can barely speak English, and their accents are so thick, it's impossible to understand what they are saying. I do NOT recommend Lebara. No doubt they will answer this review with a copy and pasted, one size fits all platitude instead of actually doing anything.

Review Highlight: The phone porting initially failed and‚Ä¶
Review: After 4 months on a Monthly contract, my phone stopped working and I could only make emergency calls.I wasn't sure why, however my PayPal account had been hacked by scammers.And I couldn't use my mobile phone.I spoke twice in one day to try to get it sorted and on the second phone call after 45min on the phone I was cut off.Phoned following day and did get a person who understood what I was trying to say.So SIM cancelled and now new SIM in post.However once I eventually managed to get into my account and looking at usage the scammers had used 11gig of my data in just a week and over the 4 months there was 40 pages of SMS messages sent and not by me.Also the scammers had in 2 days made roughly 2,000 calls via my account!!!!Obviously for 3 days I was blocked out of my account.I don't understand how this company didn't see my mobile phone making 2,000 calls in 2 days?????I asked someone to look at my usage, but they said no they couldn't.So as far as I am aware.Nothing has been done about this scammer.So please tell me why should I trust this company ever again.Definitely the worst experience of my life!!!!And yes it has taught me to look at my account online regularly.But never had to do it in the past.So security for me has been totally rubbish.It seems my phone was scammed from day one of fitting the new SIM.In house Scammer????

Review Highlight: Neha was very helpful and problem was solved.
Review: I joined Lebara approximately 3 months ago, and initially there were no problems. However, two weeks ago data stopped working. Knowing iPhones very well, I looked everywhere on the phone to see if anything had changed on it. Nothing had, so I consequently called Lebara customer services. They then talked me through how to change the APN details, which did not work, so I called again. This did not solve the problem and I called yet again. This person also changed them and said she would call me back to check if data had returned. She did not call back to see if her alterations had worked.Because I was due to travel to France and Belgium two days later, receiving data was absolutely imperative for me, so I then decided to contact Apple support, who quickly resolved the issue.When I arrived in France - guess what - no data! Lebara‚Äôs phone number could also not be connected.Thank goodness I was out of the UK for one day only - which is actually not the point, especially when I was counting on using gps to reach my destination in Belgium.On my return home, Lebara‚Äôs explanation was that in France I should have returned the APN details to how they were originally. HOW WAS I SUPPOSED TO KNOW THIS, AND WHAT WERE THEY?And of course a huge issue is that Lebara has only ONE telephone number on which to contact them, which is ridiculous when this does not connect from abroad.I have twice contacted their CEO to complain, but as personable as most of the representatives are, the company is not as efficient as expected. Mind you, they did promptly refund my ¬£10 monthly fee. However, had I been overseas for a longer period and in an area with no hotspot locations, how on earth would I have been able to get by?My second (continued) complaint has yet to be addressed.To all potential Lebara clients, I hope this helps with your decision if changing to this network provider.Lebara quickly responded to this review and kindly refunded another ¬£10.They also assured me that my data issues would not happen again.However, I won‚Äôt know for certain until I return to Europe. We‚Äôll see‚Ä¶

I've had no problem when with Lebara, but when you try to leave they make it difficult to cancel the automatic payment on your 30 day contract. In the process of moving to Vodafone but as soon as I said I was leaving and I'd started moving my phone number to Vodafone, I could no longer access my Lebara online account. This is because you need to enter your phone number to access the account, but because I was moving the number it was not technically a Lebara number anymore. So I can't get in to it to stop them taking money off me via the auto renew. This isn't ideal when you're then forced to ring them to cancel but they're only open Monday to Friday 9am to 5pm and it's currently 5.30pm on a Friday. Then you have to brave the famously terribly customer service and you've got autism so you hate phone calls. All because you got a new phone and want to leave.

Review Highlight: Quick and responsive action to change‚Ä¶
Review: My partners phone contract with 3 ended and I referred her to my provider, Lebara. She initiated a twelve month contract with Lebara and I received the '¬£30 is on the way' email, with confirmation time UP TO nine weeks. Twelve weeks later no payment had been made. I made four phone calls to Customer Services; each time I was promised a link to enable payment would be sent to me. None came. Multiple emails to Lebara failed to fix it; I first received an email confirming and giving instructions to collect payment. Then a final email from Lebara suddenly declining payment.My partner still has the contract with Lebara without any problems and l can check and confirm Lebara's declined payment is unjustified; how many payments are refused where such checks are not possible. Check if you have been similarly declined payment by Lebara.The next step is for me to submit this matter to the Communications Ombudsman for resolution. I will then update this post on results.Update: I received a call within a couple of hours of posting this review and have been advised payment has been made directly to my bank, so well done Labara. But the system still needs adjusting if such effort is needed to secure payment.
Very helpful, appreciated the help

Review Highlight: I‚Äôm so grateful for Sagar‚Äôs patient‚Ä¶
Review: Our conversation with dear Selvaraj, member of staff, was really fruitful and helpful! Thank you
Neha is very good and helpful.She done a great job.

Much appreciated, Tanveer (Floor Manager), for your prompt response and for resolving the issue.To be honest, I didn‚Äôt expect to receive a callback, but you‚Äôve truly proved me wrong. It‚Äôs clear that you genuinely care about your customers, and I really appreciate that. You took the time to dig deep into the problem and delivered a solution!!Once again, thank you for turning this situation around and showing what real customer service looks like!I have changed the rating from 1 to 5 :)--------------------------Do you even review the customer calls you record, or is that just for show? Because after this appalling experience, I have serious doubts. The service I received was beyond terrible. Instead of resolving my issue, the representative mindlessly repeated the same script like a broken record. I‚Äôve never felt so frustrated‚Äîhonestly, an AI could have done a better job at addressing the problem. At least it would have tried something new instead of wasting my time!I‚Äôve been using Lebara for over 5 years, and the service was good! But now, you‚Äôve completely botched my recharge and seem utterly incapable of fixing it. To make things worse, your team seems completely fine with losing not just me but three customers to another provider, without so much as an attempt to fix the issue or keep us from leaving.And let me talk about Nivin‚Äîyour so-called "senior-most" representative, who claims there‚Äôs no supervisor above him. Really? That‚Äôs supposed to be reassuring? It‚Äôs laughable and insulting at the same time! What kind of company allows that level of arrogance without any oversight?If this is the kind of service you're offering now, it‚Äôs no wonder you‚Äôre losing customers. Horrible.

Review Highlight: Helped me alot 5star rating for saad
Review: Disappointing EU Roaming and Poor Customer ServiceI used Lebara mobile while traveling in Denmark, and the experience was frustrating. Most of the country had little to no coverage, making it unreliable for anyone needing consistent service. Their customer service is equally disappointing ‚Äì they don't call back when promised and ignore emails entirely. I raised an official complaint, which was never dealt with despite me asking for multiple updates, so I had to complain to the Telecommunications ombudsman. To make matters worse, their EU roaming is severely limited, with only a few partners in each country, which means poor connectivity across Europe. I would not recommend Lebara if you need reliable EU roaming or decent customer support.UPDATE: I emailed John-Paul (Lebara rep who responded below) on 19 September with a reference to my complaint and asked for an update. 10 days later I have not received a response to my email. This tells you everything you need to know about Lebara - they care about their image but they don‚Äôt care about customers. AVOID!

Review Highlight: Aniket was very patient and helpful
Review: The reviews here all seem like call centre staff praising themselves. All 1 or 2 reviews in their history. This network is exceptional poor if you want to use EU roaming.My experience with Lebara was quite disappointing. I switched when I saw they offered EU roaming and used the Vodafone network. However, in Switzerland, Spain, France, Germany and Ireland, all I could get was the E (edge) connection. No data, no texts and very poor phone coverage on the rare occasion I got anything at all. I changed all the APN settings as instructed and still nothing. Having contacted Lebara support 5 times now, I've decided to change to a new provider. Less than a month from I switched and very poor service. Don't waste your time and money on this substandard mobile service.An additional issue arose after I moved from Lebara. Within a few days of porting my number I began recieving lots of spam calls. I am very careful not to put my number on public facing areas and had no spam calls under my previous network. I would be interested in hearing from others who may have had the same experience

I rarely leave reviews but wanted to after a positive experience here. I switched from Vodafone pay monthly after 5 years. The process was seemless. Number was ported over on the correct day. My Vodafone Sim stopped working overnight, and the new Lebara Sim with my old number were working at 3 pm. The signal and data speed is exactly the same as it was with my Vodafone pay monthly. I live in the city so the signal is pretty good anyway, but I haven‚Äôt noticed any differences at all. The app is also really good. I am pleased I switched. It is saving me ¬£25 a month. As long as they keep the service as good, and the prices competitive, they will do well.

Review: Terrible customer service! I noticed I was being charged earlier and earlier each month for my 30 day month to month contract and when I contacted customer service they told me it‚Äôs because some months have 31 days and some 30 days. They must really think I‚Äôm an idiot  because that doesn‚Äôt account for charging me 4 days earlier. Both customer service agents I spoke to spouted me the same nonsense. One pretended the issue is resolved but when I spoke to the second agent turns about nothing was done. They seem to have different billing records to what was actually being charged. I felt so outraged by the principle of the matter and god knows how many days earlier they might have tried to get away with it left unchecked. Customer service was so useless, with inconsistent records and I just decided to switch network providers. Avoid!!!

Horrendous! Don't be tempted by the cheaper prices that lure you into this network. They 'tag' off the Vodafone network, yet two other devices use the official Vodafone network in my household and Lebara just dosen't compare.When outside of Wifi areas, I receive intermittent service, and for some reason the ability to connect to any data - very frustrating when you're wanting to connect to the internet outside of Wifi areas, or use apps.Their customer service is appalling, with colleagues providing inconsistent information - some tell me to use the APN 'mobi.lebara.uk' others ask me to use 'wap.vodafone.co.uk' - depending on what day of the week it is.I've also written to Martin Lewis to encourage him to flag this in his weekly e-mail; and if you currently compare at Uswitch at the moment at SIM only deals, you can get an O2 sim for ¬£7.99 with 30gig of data and unlimited mins and text + EU roaming, which is a much better with a core provider!

Lebara may use the Vodaphone network, buts it‚Äôs the soggy end of the network. Even in the UK my partner and I regularly lose the ability to use 3G and 4G mobile data. The UK is rolling out 5G and we can barely get 3G on a good day. Inclusive European roaming is fraught with issues and even buying a bundle for the USA didn‚Äôt work. I‚Äôm still waiting for my refund after a year. As is very common these days, companies are cutting costs by using overseas call centres which add increasing frustration when trying to sort issues out. Lebara‚Äôs customer service is appalling. Me, my Mum and my partner have had nothing but trouble with this network over the last few years and have now have taken the issues to the Ombudsman. Once sorted, we will be switching to another provider.Update: 18/09/2924: The Ombudsman has just ruled in my favour (upheld my complaint) agreeing that Lebara did not take the appropriate action to resolve my issues. Furthermore Lebara continually failed to respond to my complaints and queries made over the last two years and as such I will be awarded compensation.Lebara‚Äôs treatment of me, as a valued customer, has been nothing short of unacceptable! I have since moved to O2 for the same price and have no issues with my mobile data, in fact I now get 5G at home.As I stated above, be warned, Lebara use the soggy end of the Vodafone network - it is not as good!

Thanks so much Shan!
Priya Thakre was very welcoming and attended to my request instantly. This is great customer service, and I will always be glad to have her attend to me. Thank you Priya Thakre

prompt response time with a satisfactory conclusion

This is a copy of an email I sent them... I write this email with regards to the issues I've experienced with Lebara since I ported my number over to yourselves. I contacted one of your advisors around 2 weeks ago to explain the issues I've been experiencing with regards to sending SMS messages, he went through some checks and then stated he'd passed it onto the tech team and I'd get an update within 72 hours. After 72 hours I'd received no update... So I contacted yourselves again, to be told the first agent I spoke to hadn't transferred the issue to the tech team at all. He went through the same checks and told me it's be fixed as a priority within 48 hours. I tried to send a text a few days later and it still wasn't working, so again I contacted yourselves to be told it'd be transferred to the tech team again and that I'd get an update within a few days, that was around a week ago and I still can't send SMS messages. I strongly believe the issue occurred during my number port to yourselves. Can you please look into this as I feel I'm getting no where with your agents.Update... I did get a response at 18:24, they stated it was fixed. It most certainly is not.
I think your customer order website is very poor, but your agent Priya Thakray was absolutely brilliant at sorting out my problem.

The issue was with account login and the lady was very patient and helpful pointing me to the right places when i was clearly slow to enter my details and kept making mistakes. But she corrected me and we managed to resolve this
I just contacted Lebara for a problem I had and Fariyaz did an amazing job helping me with my request. He was very professional and efficient. Thanks again!

Raafe helped me twice today & in addition, he kept his word - ringing me back, as I was unable to change my password via my mobile number nor via my email. It was impossible to login to my Lebara App.I sent a screenshot to prove your website was not synchronised with mine - Lebara saying, "The phone number is invalid." Good grief!His patience was stretched; I am elderly & was extremely irritated at Lebara's incompetence over the last few weeks, with poor advice and a promised call not being made to me. Thus problems continued and i was about to close my account.Raafe has restored my confidence in Lebara & soon had my accountoperating correctly. My number has existed with you for years!Raafe persisted & found a solution for me. His EXCELLENT creative brain found a way at last!THANK YOU RAAFE.Your work is greatly appreciated.

In terms of the mobile service they provide it is very good.However as to their rewards payments for referrals my experience is that they do not honour their commitments.Still waiting for a payment they claimed they sent on 29 August. 12 days later I have still not received it.Used their chat line and some days later their call line to resolve the issue but sadly no satisfaction. The last gentleman I spoke to asked me to put everything I told him in writing by email. Bearing in mind the reward was only ¬£10 and the amount of time I had already wasted on this matter I told him that his company could keep the money but that I was a very dissatisfied customer.PostscriptLEBARA transferred the ¬£10 reward into my account within 24 hours of my review.Despite my initial frustrating experience with the company, they resolved the problem speedily and to my satisfaction
